subtitleNullable: Pest control in greenhouses - object detection
descriptionNullable:
### Context

Yellow sticky traps are used in agricultural greenhouses to monitor the spread and intensity of insects. In Europe *Trialeurodes vaporariorum* and *Bemisia tabaci* (greenhouse whitefly) in tomatoes are listed in the top 10 of the most problematic pests in greenhouse vegetable crops. Insects can be attracted and monitored on these traps. Counting and classification of insects is time-consuming and error-prone as it is only partly automated (or still counted by hand) by classical thresholding and blob counting algorithms. Growers can apply integrated pest management strategies based on the insect pressure in their greenhouse. 


### Content

The content is 284 images 3456 x 5184 and 5184 x 3456. Each images is annoted with LabelImg. There are 3 classes to consider:

In total 1312 Macrolophus MR have been annotated

In total 510 Nesidiocoris NC have been annotated

In total 5591 Whiteflies WF have been annotated

There is even a fourth class (TR) *Thysanoptera* but since there are limited annotations you can disregard that one.


### Acknowledgements

The data is published by 4TU: a collaboration of 4 technical universities in the Netherlands. The dataset can be found [here](https://data.4tu.nl/repository/uuid:8b8ba63a-1010-4de7-a7fb-6f9e3baf128e) together with the corresponding articles. 
This dataset is part of the ERANet research programme C-IPM and the project PeMaToEuroPep. The data collection here was funded by the Dutch research organization NWO and the Dutch Topsector Tuinbouw en Uitgangsmaterialen 


### Inspiration

The 4TU researchers got a precision of  87.4%. Are you able to top that?

### Tags

Insects, Flies, Object Detection, Pest Control, Greenhouse, Horticulture, Agriculture, Food, Environment, image classification, vision.
title: Yellow sticky traps
